info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 19 at 4:17PM EDT until July 19 at 10:15PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
FFWRNK
The National Weather Service in Blacksburg has issued a
* Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Henry County in south central Virginia...
* Until 1015 PM EDT.
* At 417 PM EDT, stream gauge reports of flooding along Blackberry Creek near Bassett thanks to heavy rain producing thunderstorms across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly.
HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms.
SOURCE...Gauges reported.
IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas.
* Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Bassett... Sanville... Stanleytown... Collinsville...
This includes the following streams and drainages... Horse Pasture Creek, Koger Creek, Smith River, Blackberry Creek and Spencer Creek.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on X.
